attributes.title: Coors
attributes.description:
Created on November 29, 2010 by KellyB on Sourcemap.org:

The Coors Brewery in Golden, CO makes some of the most well known beer in America. Adolph Coors began the Brewery in the 1800s, which was the beginning of one of America's most popular beers.

attributes.name: Coors
attributes.title: Coors
attributes.description: The Coors Brewery in Golden, CO makes some of the most well known beer in America. Adolph Coors began the Brewery in the 1800s, which was the beginning of one of America's most popular beers.

attributes.name: Water
attributes.title: Water
attributes.description: The soft water from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is one of the main ingredients that goes into making Coors such a delicious beer. The water has just the right mineral content for making beer.

attributes.name: Hops
attributes.title: Hops
attributes.description: The hops for Coors comes from Idaho, Washington and Oregon which is transported to the Brewery in Golden, Colorado.

attributes.name: New Zealand Hops
attributes.title: New Zealand Hops
attributes.description: Some hops are shipped to the United States, probably in container ships before being trucked to the Coors Brewery in Colorado.

attributes.name: German Hops
attributes.title: German Hops
attributes.description: There are also hops imported from Germany, which are also shipped to the United States before making their way into the beer at Golden, Colorado.

attributes.name: Barley
attributes.title: Barley
attributes.description: The 2-row barley used in Coors and Coors Light comes from local farmers in northern Colorado.
